paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The BRCA2 p.A75P mutation is, however, not classified as predisposing to breast/ovarian cancer by LOVD [19], or ClinVar.

functional_data.summary: Predicted as damaging by all four in silico prediction algorithms.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is not classified as pathogenic.
key_quotes: The BRCA2 p.A75P mutation is, however, not classified as predisposing to breast/ovarian cancer by LOVD [19], or ClinVar.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two of the nonsense mutations (p.C675X and p.E1013X) in BRCA1, 7 of the frameshift (p.N1626*11, p.N3024*16, p.Q1429*8, p.L2092*6, p.K1057*7 (x2), and p.F1546*21) in BRCA2 and a single frameshift (p.Q60*6) in PALB2 would predispose the carrier to breast/ovarian cancer.

functional_data.summary: Nonsense mutation leading to premature termination of the protein.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with breast/ovarian cancer in families.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is associated with a high risk of breast/ovarian cancer.
key_quotes: Two of the nonsense mutations (p.C675X and p.E1013X) in BRCA1, 7 of the frameshift (p.N1626*11, p.N3024*16, p.Q1429*8, p.L2092*6, p.K1057*7 (x2), and p.F1546*21) in BRCA2 and a single frameshift (p.Q60*6) in PALB2 would predispose the carrier to breast/ovarian cancer.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
